Nerangs.ab: pad *nērang ī wars puxtan nazdist dumb ī gāw ī nar kē arus mōy abāg hamāg handām tā pāy ud sumb ud manaoθra ud čašm ud srū hamāg spēd bawēd āwarišn ud hamāg hannām ud dumb pāk kunišn ud dō mard ī yōždahrgar kē yašt *nōg nāwar kard estēd pēš ān gāw āyēd ud pad xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū sē bār dumb ī gāw pādyāb čiyōn urwarām bē kunišn ud wāz ī ōhrmazd xwadāy kū šnūman ī ōhrmazd xwadāy tā maraotū *gōwišn

"According to the instruction for boiling the wars, first, they should bring the tail of a male bull that has white hair in all his limbs except feet, hoofs, neck, eyes and horns. He has to wash all limbs and the tail and two yōždahrgar who have perforemd a Yašt Nōg-nāwar, should go to this bull and at xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three aṣ̌əm vohū, he has to purify three times the bull's tail in the same as they have to do with the urwarām and he has to say the wāz ī ōhrmazd that includes the šnūman ī ōhrmazd up to maraōtu."
nērang wars puxtan nadist dēg-e pad pādyāb kard ud zōhr-ē abar griftan ud sē srešk war ī ātaxš warhrām andar afgandan ud wāz bē guftan wāz ōhrmazd griftan dast ud war pad pādyād bē kardan

"Instruction for boiling the vars. He should wash the vessel and take the zur. He should throw in it three pinches of ashes from the ātaš varharām and say the vāǧ and take the wāǧ for Urmazd and wash the hands and the vars with pādyāb."

ParagnaLL6.1.1 Var. c (Ms. RKS (Unvala 2.31 ff.) . It is likely that the original was a Pāzand version identical or similar to the one of ms. F13. The text is better there. Cf. ParagnaLL5.1.1-3 Var. d):

nirang-e vars poḫtan naḫost yek āv pādyāv āvāyad andāḫtan pas ṣabāḥ dast be-pādyāv kardan dig be-pādyāv kardan u pādyāb be-zur avar gereftan be-dig se †serešk vari ātaš āvāyad kardan andak-i be-dig kardan vāǧ hurmazd gereftan dast vars be-pādyāv be-kardan

"Instruction for boiling the vars. First, one should collect pādyāv-water. Then, at the morningdawn, he should wash his hands with pādyāv, wash a vessel with pādyāv and pour the pādyāv into the zur. He should put three pinches of ashes from the fire into the vessel and add (a further) pinch to the vessel. He should take the vāǧ for Hurmazd and wash the hands and the vars."

"Instruction for boiling the vars. First, one should collect pādyāv-water one night.
